newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador's crude rises to $19.02 per barrel.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador's crude rises to $19.02 per barrel.

text.p: The reference price of Ecuador's crude rose to an average $19.02 per barrel Aug 15 from $18.85 registered the day before, a spokesman for state-run Petroecuador oil company said Wednesday.
The price is tied to Alaska North Slope (USG) and Oman crude prices, with different discounts payable in 30 days.
The price average in July was 17.46 per barrel, while in July 1995 it was $14.13.
Ecuador withdrew from OPEC in December 1992.
